cui_name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 21 hydroxylase deficiency
reasoning: Classic 21-hydroxylase deficiency CAH occurs in ~1 per 15,000 births globally. With crude birth rate of ~20 per 1,000 population, this translates to ~0.14 per 100k person-years.
source: Speiser PW et al. (2010). Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to steroid 21-hydroxylase deficiency: an Endocrine Society clinical practice guideline. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 95(9):4133-60
